description.en: The course provides an overview of Estonian literary history in the context of the Estonian cultural history with a focus on the central authors of the literary canon and outlines main tendencies and phenomena in contemporary Estonian literature. It also focuses on literary institutions and organisations and publication and information channels. The course takes place in combined format of seminar and lectures. Lectures provide wider cultural contexts and introduction to literary periods and phenomena. Seminars will focus on the discussion and analysis of a selection of literary works and on films based on literary works. In case it is possible, the course will include literary excursions and tours (e.g., the Estonian Literary Museum, Tartu as Unesco Literary City).
description.et: Kursus annab ülevaate eesti kirjandusloost üldises kultuuriloolises kontekstis, samuti käsitletakse eesti nüüdiskirjanduse põhijooni, suundi ja autoreid, samuti kirjandusega seotud asutusi, organisatsioone, väljaandeid ja infokanaleid. Kursus toimub loengute ja seminaride segaformaadina. Loengutes antakse laiem kirjandus- ja kultuurilooline taust, seminarid keskenduvad kirjandusteoste ja nende põhjal tehtud filmide arutelule. Võimalusel hõlmab kursus ka ekskursioone Tartu kirjanduslikesse paikadesse (nt Eesti Kirjandusmuuseum, kirjanduslik Tartu, Tartu kui UNESCO kirjanduslinn).

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to give foreign students an overview of Estonian literary history and contemporary Estonian literature in the context of the Estonian cultural history. At the same time the course offers Estonian students an opportunity to increase experience in introducing Estonian literature to foreign audiences in foreign language.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on eesti kirjandusloo, selle olulisemate protsesside ja autorite  ning nüüdiskirjanduse  peamiste suundade tutvustamine välisüliõpilastele üldise Eesti kultuuriloo kontekstis ning ühtlasi võimaluse pakkumine kohalikele üliõpilastele kogemuste omandmiseks eesti kirjanduse tutvustamisel võõrkeeles ja teistsuguse kultuuritaustaga inimestele.

learning_outcomes.en:
Foreign students acquire an overview of the Estonian literary and cultural history and are able to connect it to the literature and culture of their country or region; they have general knowledge about the central authors and works in the Estonian literary canon and the main themes, directions and authors of contemporary Estonian literature as well as the central literary organizations and institutions in Estonia; they know how to find information about Estonian literature (magazines, databases).

Estonian students gain an experience of introducing Estonian literature in English to audiences with little previous knowledge of Estonian literature and culture, including the format of presentations and moderating discussions in English.
learning_outcomes.et:
Kursuse läbinud välisüliõpilane:
- Omab ülevaadet eesti kirjanduse arengust ja oskab seda suhestada Eesti üldise kultuurilooga ja võrdlevalt oma maa/regiooni kirjanduskultuuriga
- Omab ülevaadet eesti kirjanduskaanoni ja nüüdiskirjanduse kesksetest autoritest ja nende loomingust ning  kirjandusega seotud asutustest ja organisatsioonidest Eestis 
- Oskab otsida täiendavat infot eesti kirjanduse kohta (ajakirjad, andmebaasid) 

Kursuse läbinud kohalik üliõpilane:
- Oskab tutvustada eesti kirjandust ja kultuuri inglise keeles väheste eelteadmistega inimestele, sh ingliskeelse ettekande ja temaatiliste diskussioonide vormis.

independent_work.et:
Preparation for the seminars (reading the assigned texts). 
Reading journal. 10 entries of about 250 words for every seminar topic that reflects on themes, formal and generic features of the works covered. Deadline: one week after the class where the topics were discussed.  Each student can skip one topic.

Literary history group assignment. Foreign students and Estonian students work together, group size depends on number of participants in the course. Each group prepares an overview of one period of Estonian literature and presents it in class also submitting a powerpoint, Prezi presentation or presentation text that will be uploaded to the course Moodle site.  Presentation should be about 15 minutes, use of illustrative material (photos, videos, extracts of literary texts is encouraged). Presentation topic also include authors whose work is discussed in seminars (group size 2 students).

Presentation topics:
Literary processes and central authors from late 19th century until 1940. Fiction.
Literary processes and central authors from late 19th century until 1940. Poetry.
Estonian literature during the Soviet era. Several foci can be picked and more than one presentation on this topic can be prepared.
Estonian literature from the late 1980s until the turn of the century. Several foci can be picked and more than one presentation on this topic can be prepared.
Contemporary Estonian literature. Here as well, several foci and be selected.

Group presentation on one period of Estonian literature. 
Participation in cultural tours (in case participation is possible and in case they take place).

description.et: Introduction, topics, readings and tasks. Seminar: a glimpse of Estonian literature.
Estonian folk heritage. Excursion to the Estonian Folklore Archive of the Estonian Literary Museum (Vanemuise 42).
Early Estonian Literature. Poetry of Lydia Koidula and Kristjan Jaak Peterson. Life story of Mäletu Jaan.
Reading week. Watching the film Tõde ja õigus (Truth and Justice) or Reading part I of the novel.
A. H. Tammsaare. Truth and justice/Tõde ja õigus (1926-1933). Discussion of the film and the novel.
Poetry of Juhan Liiv, Gustav Suits, Marie Under and Betti Alver.
Juhan Smuul. "Antractica Ahoi!" Jaan Kross "The Ashtray."
Imbi Paju's documentary "Memories Denied" (Tõrjutud mälestused, 2005) or Martti Helde's film "In the Crosswind" (Risttuules, 2014). A selection of Estonian life stories concerning Soviet repressions.
Reading week. Please read one novel (The Border State, The Seventh Spring of Peace, The Willow King  or The Man Who Spoke Snakish) in full.
Contemporary Estonian fiction. Tõnu Õnnepalu. "The Border State" (Piiririik) or, shorter selections by several authors.  Viivi Luik "The Seventh Spring of Peace" (1984, selections).
Contemporary Estonian Fiction. Meelis Friedenthal. "The Willow King" or Andrus Kivirähk "The Man Who Spoke Snakish" (selections).
Excursion to Juhan Liivi Museum in Kodavere or literary tour of Tartu.
